wdkModel.paramSet: Gene IDs (locus tags) are quite different for each species. We use the gene IDs provided by the sequence generator. Enter the minimum mutual information score to report similarities. The score range is from 0.472 to 1.67 Enter the minimum number of queries you want to match to your genes. If you input 5 genes ids for your query and enter 5 minimum number of queries then the only genes returned would be ones that all 5 queries match Enzyme Commission numbers describe enzymes hierarchically by the class of rections they catalize. Use '-' as a wildcard in place of numbers to denote partial EC Numbers. Which genes in Plasmodium are annotated as containing introns? One easy way to do this search is to look for genes with more than one annotated exon. Enter a minimum of exons you would like to search for as an integer, e.g. '3'. Enter a maximum number of exons you would like to search for as an integer, e.g. '3'. Select ... Select ... Select ... Select ... Proteins may have none, one or more transmembrane domains. Please enter a minimum number of predicted transmembrane domains to start your search. Proteins may have none, one or more transmembrane domains. Please enter a maximum number of predicted transmembrane domains to start your search. SignalP provides four scores and a conclusion for each such that the conclusion is 1 if the score meets a certain criteria and 0 otherwise. The SignalP summary conclusion is the sum of the four conclusions generated by SignalP, thus four is the highest score possible. We consider a summary conclusion score of three to be significant The name of an external database as found in GUS The version of an external database release as found in GUS Sequence IDs for P. falciparum chromosomes are 'MAL1' through 'MAL14.' Sequence IDs for P. yoelii contigs begin with 'MALPY'. Sequence IDs for P. vivax contigs begin with 'ctg_'. Wild cards are permitted in this search, i.e. use MALPY* to ask for all P. vivax sequences. Select one or more organisms. Select an organism. Select an organism. = 97%) between the GenBank proteins listed on IEDB and the proteins found in PlasmoDB, and exact string matching. Confidence levels are assigned to each set of epitopes based on the quality of this mapping. A high confidence is assigned to a set where all of the epitopes are found on a given BLAST hit. A medium confidence is assigned to a set where either some, but not all, of the epitopes in a set are found on a given BLAST hit, or where all of the epitopes in a set are found in a given protein, but the protein was not identified as a match by BLAST. A low confidence is assigned to sets where some, but not all, of the epitopes are found in a given protein, but the protein was not identified by BLAST. Choose one or more assigned confidence levels to search for epitopes in. Upper Bound on the ratio of non-synonymous to synonymous coding snps Lower Bound on the ratio of non-synonymous to synonymous coding snps Lower Bound on the number of coding snps Upper Bound on the number of SNPs of the selected class Lower Bound on the number of SNPs of the selected class Upper Bound on the number of strains that have the major allele Lower Bound on the number strains that have the major allele Find genes containing a density of coding snps > this parameter. Density is expressed in number of snps / KB of coding sequence Click yes to include P. reichenowi snps in this query. P.r snps were generated by alignment of P. reichenowi sequence with the P falciparum 3D7 reference sequence. Note, if you want to only query reichenowi, you must click 'None' in the P. falciparum strains select list. Click yes to to restrict the results returned to only those genes which have been input as query ids. This allows you to determine the relatedness of your query set Choose the class of SNP you want to query on ... choose minumum and maximum numbers below Results will be sorted on this column in descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Lower bound on nucleotide range to search for gene Upper bound on nucleotide range to search for gene. Use a number larger than the sequence length to search to the end of the sequence. Lower bound on expression percentile. Upper bound on expression percentile. Lower bound on expression percentile. Upper bound on expression percentile. Lower bound on expression percentile. Upper bound on expression percentile. Lower bound on expression percentile. Upper bound on expression percentile. Lower bound on expression percentile. Upper bound on expression percentile. Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order This will be generated by clicking the species tree nodes. Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Results will be sorted ascending or descending order Choose a reagent type Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif Lower bound for the protein isoelectric point Upper bound for the protein isoelectric point Lower bound for the protein molecular weight Upper bound for the protein molecular weight Example: '%hsa:N%pfa:Y%' List of included species (for documentation only) List of excluded species (for documentation only) mininum requirement of score by ExportPred algorithm Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif Set a minimum for the likelihood of interaction Select a lifecycle stage from the list provided. Use this parameter to set a minimum amount of (amino acid) sequence coverage for the mass spec-predicted peptides. For example, setting this parameter to 10 will return only those genes whose proteins are at least 10% covered by mass spec.-predicted peptides. In the current dataset the average percent coverage is about 9%, and the maximum is about 90%. Note that even if this parameter is set to 0%, only genes with at least some mass spec. predictions for the specified stage will be returned. In other words, it never returns proteins with 0% coverage, only those with strictly > 0%. Use this parameter to set a minimum for the number of nonoverlapping regions (spans) that must be found in the mass spec. data for a gene (and the specified lifecycle stage). Only genes with at least this many spans are returned Use this parameter to set a minimum for the number of mass spectra found that must match a gene in order for it to be returned by the query. Roughly speaking this parameter provides a measure of the abundance of the protein product in question, at least within a particular experiment. Enter a GenBank Accession number Enter an upper bound on the distance. Enter an lower bound on the percent of low complexity. Enter an upper bound on the distance Select whether to measure the start point from the beginning or end of the sequence Select whether to measure the end point from the beginning or end of the sequence Select whether to measure the end point from the beginning or end of the sequence Only consider BLAST similarities with a P-value less than ten to the given power. Select one or more clades. Enter a GenBank, RefSeq, or SwissProt accession number Choose a lower bound on the coil percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of coil will be returned. Choose a upper bound on the coil percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of coil will be returned. Choose a lower bound on the strand percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of strand will be returned. Choose a upper bound on the strand percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of strand will be returned. Choose a lower bound on the helix percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of helix will be returned. Choose a upper bound on the helix percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of helix will be returned. The Gene Id The method used to calculate the similarity distance The number of genes in the result The searching goal of the profile similarity query

sqlQuery.name: OrganismWithGenes
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT orgs.term, (select apidb.tab_to_string(CAST(COLLECT(trim(to_char(taxon_id))) AS apidb.varchartab), ', ') as internal FROM sres.taxon CONNECT BY prior taxon_id = parent_id START WITH taxon_id = orgs.internal_tax) as internal FROM (SELECT tn.name AS term, t.taxon_id AS internal_tax FROM sres.TaxonName tn, sres.taxon t WHERE tn.name_class='scientific name' AND t.taxon_id = tn.taxon_id AND t.rank = 'species' AND t.taxon_id in (SELECT taxon_id FROM sres.taxon CONNECT BY taxon_id = prior parent_id START WITH taxon_id IN (SELECT ens.taxon_id FROM dots.ExternalNaSequence ens, dots.GeneFeature gf WHERE gf.na_sequence_id = ens.na_sequence_id))) orgs, (SELECT 'Plasmodium falciparum' AS term, 1 as rank from dual UNION SELECT 'Plasmodium vivax' AS term, 2 as rank from dual UNION SELECT 'Plasmodium yoelii' AS term, 3 as rank from dual) partial_order WHERE orgs.term = partial_order.term(+) ORDER BY partial_order.rank

sqlQuery.name: OrganismWithEC
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT tn.name AS term, t.taxon_id AS internal, rownum AS idx FROM sres.TaxonName tn, sres.taxon t WHERE tn.name_class='scientific name' AND t.taxon_id = tn.taxon_id AND t.rank = 'species' AND t.taxon_id in (SELECT taxon_id FROM sres.taxon CONNECT BY taxon_id = prior parent_id START WITH taxon_id IN (SELECT taxon_id FROM dots.ExternalNaSequence)) AND tn.name LIKE '%falciparum%'

sqlQuery.name: GeneTypes
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(term_name, 'non_protein_coding', 'misc RNA'), '_encoding', ''), '_', ' ') AS term, sequence_ontology_id AS internal FROM sres.SequenceOntology WHERE term_name IN ('protein_coding', 'rRNA_encoding', 'snRNA_encoding', 'tRNA_encoding', 'non_protein_coding')

sqlQuery.name: ExtraerythrocyticStages
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT name AS term, element_order AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name IN ('Sporozoite', 'Gametocyte') UNION SELECT 'Either' AS term, 0 as internal FROM dual ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: IntraerythrocyticStages
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT name AS term, element_order AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name IN ('Early Ring', 'Late Ring', 'Early Schizogony', 'Late Schizogony', 'Early Trophozoite', 'Late Trophozoite', 'Merozoite') UNION SELECT 'Any' AS term, 0 as internal FROM dual ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: Mr4Reagents
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT term, internal FROM (SELECT reagent_type AS term, reagent_type AS internal, rownum AS ord FROM (SELECT DISTINCT lower(dr.secondary_identifier) AS reagent_type FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND ed.name = 'MR4DBxRefs' ORDER BY lower(dr.secondary_identifier)) UNION SELECT 'any' AS term, 'any' AS internal, 0 AS ord FROM dual) ORDER BY ord

sqlQuery.name: Clades
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT tn.name AS term, taxon_id AS internal FROM sres.taxonname tn WHERE tn.name IN ('Archaea', 'Eukaryota', 'Apicomplexa', 'Chordata', 'Bacteria')

sqlQuery.name: DomainDatabase
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT ed.name AS term, edr.external_database_release_id AS internal FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND dr.db_ref_id IN (SELECT draf.db_ref_id FROM dots.DomainFeature df, dots.DbRefAaFeature draf, core.AlgorithmInvocation ainv, core.AlgorithmImplementation aimp WHERE df.aa_feature_id = draf.aa_feature_id AND df.row_alg_invocation_id = ainv.algorithm_invocation_id AND ainv.algorithm_implementation_id = aimp.algorithm_implementation_id AND aimp.executable = 'ApiCommonData::Load::Plugin::InsertInterproscanResults') UNION SELECT ' Choose one:' AS term, -1 AS internal FROM dual ORDER BY term

sqlQuery.name: DayAndStrain
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.profile_element_name_id AS internal, DECODE(ps.name, 'winzeler_NF54_pct', 'Strain NF54', 'winzeler_3D7_pct', 'Strain 3D7', 'winzeler_3D7_MACpct', 'Strain 3D7 (MACS-purified)', ps.name) || REPLACE(pen.name, 'Day', ' Day ') AS term FROM apidb.profileSet ps, apidb.profileElementName pen WHERE ps.name IN ('winzeler_3D7_MACpct', 'winzeler_3D7_pct','winzeler_NF54_pct') AND ps.profile_set_id = pen.profile_set_id ORDER BY ps.name, pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: cowmanSample
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct lg.name AS term, lg.logical_group_id AS internal FROM STUDY.Study s, RAD.StudyAssay sa, RAD.AssayAnalysis aa, RAD.analysis a, RAD.Protocol p, RAD.AnalysisInput ai, RAD.LogicalGroup lg WHERE s.name in ('Molecular mechanism for switching of P.falciparum invasion pathways into human erythrocytes', 'P.falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout', 'Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites suggests a hierarchy of molecular interactions') AND p.name = 'R Expression Statistics' AND sa.study_id = s.study_id AND aa.assay_id = sa.assay_id AND a.analysis_id = aa.analysis_id AND a.protocol_id = p.protocol_id AND ai.analysis_id = a.analysis_id AND lg.logical_group_id = ai.logical_group_id

sqlQuery.name: MetabolicPathways
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT dr.primary_identifier AS internal, TRIM(REPLACE(REPLACE(decode(dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier, null, dr.primary_identifier, dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier),'"',''), CHR(191),'')) AS term FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND ed.name = 'Links to Pathway Maps' AND dr.primary_identifier != 'qualityControl' ORDER BY term
